Posts.Content: My results came back and they are thankfully benign. Good luck to everyone :)
Posts.Title: Clusters of Microcalcifications-What does this mean?

Posts.Content: Probably not. I think they have to do a biopsy to confirm everything. I have rhe same thing and had a biopsy yesterday. Now I have to wait for the test results.
Posts.Title: kursten

Posts.Content: That was me a couple days ago. Thankfully everything was benign. Hopefuuly you can get the biopsy sooner than later to give you a peace of mind. Prayers ad good thoughts to you :)
Posts.Title: Calcifications and biopsies.....

Posts.Content:
I got my results...and benign! The waiting is the worst part but it is so worth knowing one way or the other.
Good luck to you Kursten. Keep me posted :)
Posts.Title: kursten

Posts.Content:
Hi all,
I am 43, and went for my first mammogram ever last Thursday. Yesterday, I get a call saying that I had some calcifications, and they I was need to come back in for another mammogram. The radiologist said that I had a few clusters of microcalcifications and that he wanted the largest one to be biopsied. He said most likely they were benign, but recommended the biopsy to be sure. Today I had a core biopsy done. Overall, it was uncomfortable but manageable.
Anyway, the test results don't come back fro 3-7 days. I can't stop crying. I know the chance of it being benign is like 75-80%, but I can't relax. I had a few clusters, not just one. Does anyone know if this is good or bad?
Any insight or experience on the subject is appreciated :)
Posts.Title: Clusters of Microcalcifications-What does this mean?

Posts.Content: Did you have a biopsy on it?
Posts.Title: kursten
